Description: Rim sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of rosette, pomegranate and lotus flower frieze in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: short vertical stroke pattern between pairs of lines; below, painted decoration consisting of part of head, neck and antlers of deer, to left.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in the Mature Animal Style, however, the rim pattern decoration and the use of brown outline is more consistent with the Grand Style.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. V, no. 23)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 264, no. 556, pl. 68)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0799) (phase 2)
